alert.note: Alert for Codington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 15 at 9:43AM MDT until April 18 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue affecting Codington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River Near Watertown affecting Codington County. Lake Kampeska At Watertown Water Plant affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Above Lake Kampeska affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River at Watertown Sioux Conifer Road affecting Codington County. Big Sioux River Near Florence affecting Grant County. Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River at Watertown Broadway Avenue. * WHEN...Until early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, The lower banks on both sides of the river downstream of the gauge are overtopped, and the lower lying areas along Kampeska Blvd, 4th Ave SW, and Riverside Park on Kemp Ave begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Saturday was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Tuesday morning and continue falling to 9.6 feet Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued this evening by 700 PM CDT.
